src.async_peoplesoft_api module

class src.async_peoplesoft_api.AsyncPeopleSoftAPI(oracledb: OracleDB | None = None)

Bases: object

Asynchronous client for interacting with the PeopleSoft API.

base_url

Base URL for the API.

Type:

str

oracledb

Database connection for logging.

Type:

OracleDB, optional

generate_auth_token()

Generates the authorization token for the API.

This function reads a PEM file to create a JWT token, which is used for API authentication.

Returns:

An authorization token for API requests in the format “Bearer <token>”.

Return type:

str

async get(session: ClientSession, endpoint: str, params: dict = {})

Makes a GET request to the specified API endpoint.

Parameters:

  • session (aiohttp.ClientSession) – The aiohttp session to use for the request.

  • endpoint (str) – The API endpoint to request data from.

  • params (dict, optional) – Query parameters to include in the request. Defaults to an empty dictionary.

Returns:

The response from the API request.

Return type:

aiohttp.ClientResponse

async get_fields(endpoint: str) → int

Retrieves the field names of the records available at the specified endpoint.

Parameters:

endpoint (str) – The endpoint.

Returns:

The field names of the records available at the endpoint.

Return type:

int

async get_items(session: ClientSession, endpoint: str, params: dict = {}) → dict

Retrieves only the ‘items’ from the JSON response of a GET request.

Parameters:

  • session (aiohttp.ClientSession) – The aiohttp session to use for the request.

  • endpoint (str) – The API endpoint to request data from.

  • params (dict, optional) – Query parameters to include in the request. Defaults to an empty dictionary.

Returns:

The value for ‘items’ in the JSON response.

Return type:

dict

async get_items_concurrently(endpoint: str, limit: int = 10000, offset_chunk: list[int] | None = None) → list

Retrieves all items from the endpoint or only items for specified offsets.

Parameters:

  • endpoint (str) – The API endpoint to request data from.

  • limit (int, optional) – The maximum number of records to retrieve per request. Defaults to 10000.

  • offset_chunk (list[int], optional) – Specific offsets for the requests. If None, all records are retrieved.

Returns:

A list of records retrieved from the endpoint.

Return type:

list

async get_items_tasks(session: ClientSession, endpoint: str, limit: int, offsets: list[int] | None = None)

Produces tasks that request records from the specified endpoint.

Parameters:

  • session (aiohttp.ClientSession) – The session to use for the requests.

  • endpoint (str) – The API endpoint to request data from.

  • limit (int) – The maximum number of records to retrieve per request.

  • offsets (list[int], optional) – Specific offsets to use for the requests. If None, tasks will cover all available data.

Returns:

A list of asyncio tasks that will retrieve records from the endpoint.

Return type:

list

async get_json(session: ClientSession, endpoint: str, params: dict = {}) → dict

Makes a GET request to the API and returns the response as JSON.

Parameters:

  • session (aiohttp.ClientSession) – The aiohttp session to use for the request.

  • endpoint (str) – The API endpoint to request data from.

  • params (dict, optional) – Query parameters to include in the request. Defaults to an empty dictionary.

Returns:

The response data parsed as JSON.

Return type:

dict

async get_offsets(session: ClientSession, endpoint: str, page_size: int) → list[int]

Generates a list of offsets for paginated requests to the specified endpoint.

Parameters:

  • session (aiohttp.ClientSession) – The session to use for the request.

  • endpoint (str) – The API endpoint to request data from.

  • page_size (int) – The number of records to retrieve per request.

Returns:

A list of offsets for use in paginated requests.

Return type:

list[int]

async get_record_count(session: ClientSession, endpoint: str) → int

Retrieves the total number of records available at the specified endpoint.

Parameters:

  • session (aiohttp.ClientSession) – The aiohttp session to use for the request.

  • endpoint (str) – The endpoint that exposes the database table data.

Returns:

The total number of records available at the endpoint.

Return type:

int
